issue.title: order post tx "--generate-only"  can't create
issue.body:
@alessio 

dexcli tx order post cosmos1zjke9jp4rftfzs6nw73ut94jzl3qgk95mhdmyx 1 BID 1000000000000000000 1000000000000000000 100 --chain-id=testchain --generate-only

ERROR: accepts 5 arg(s), received 6

dexcli tx order post --from cosmos1zjke9jp4rftfzs6nw73ut94jzl3qgk95mhdmyx 1 BID 1000000000000000000 1000000000000000000 100 --chain-id=testchain  --generate-only

ERROR: no RPC client defined

Unable to generate when generating json to sign order post tx offline.
Defined in msg but cannot be processed in dexcli


https://github.com/tendermint/dex-demo/blob/master/pkg/cliutil/cli.go#L15

```go
	accGetter := authtypes.NewAccountRetriever(cliCtx)
	if err := accGetter.EnsureExists(cliCtx.GetFromAddress()); err != nil {
		return context.CLIContext{}, authtypes.TxBuilder{}, err
	}
```

This part seems to be the cause, what is its use?

issue.title: order post tx "--generate-only"  can't create
issue.body:
@alessio 

dexcli tx order post cosmos1zjke9jp4rftfzs6nw73ut94jzl3qgk95mhdmyx 1 BID 1000000000000000000 1000000000000000000 100 --chain-id=testchain --generate-only

ERROR: accepts 5 arg(s), received 6

dexcli tx order post --from cosmos1zjke9jp4rftfzs6nw73ut94jzl3qgk95mhdmyx 1 BID 1000000000000000000 1000000000000000000 100 --chain-id=testchain  --generate-only

ERROR: no RPC client defined

Unable to generate when generating json to sign order post tx offline.
Defined in msg but cannot be processed in dexcli


https://github.com/tendermint/dex-demo/blob/master/pkg/cliutil/cli.go#L15

```go
	accGetter := authtypes.NewAccountRetriever(cliCtx)
	if err := accGetter.EnsureExists(cliCtx.GetFromAddress()); err != nil {
		return context.CLIContext{}, authtypes.TxBuilder{}, err
	}
```

This part seems to be the cause, what is its use?

issue.title: this line throws error(division by zero) while our simulation
issue.body:
@alessio 

below line throws error(division by zero) while our simulation

https://github.com/tendermint/dex-demo/blob/7d412f8b8c12b470658b6e3aa6ac92e59c7b93c8/pkg/matcheng/matcher.go#L238

in orderbook, we see an residual order with amount 0.0000.
i suspect this is a decimal control issue.
because we tested only with integer amount, there is no way for orderbook to have
such small residual order.

issue.title: Start refactoring into storeutils
issue.body:
Note that the files in `storeutils` now return generic `error` objects rather than `sdk.Error`s. This is done
in an effort to decouple them from the DEX codebase. To transform the error objects back into `sdk.Error`s
that are meaningful to the DEX, I've created some wrapper functions in `types/errs/errs.go` that convert
the `error` objects into the DEC-appropriate `sdk.Error`.

issue.title: Start refactoring into storeutils
issue.body:
Note that the files in `storeutils` now return generic `error` objects rather than `sdk.Error`s. This is done
in an effort to decouple them from the DEX codebase. To transform the error objects back into `sdk.Error`s
that are meaningful to the DEX, I've created some wrapper functions in `types/errs/errs.go` that convert
the `error` objects into the DEC-appropriate `sdk.Error`.

issue.title: Replace github.com/tendermint/dex-demo/types/store with github.com/cosmos/cosmos-sdk/store
issue.body: In particular, we should ensure we use the `KVStore` implementation provided by cosmos-sdk

issue.title: README.md typo
issue.body:
"This DeX Demo is a standard Cosmos SDK application. It consists of three tools:" and then lists _two_ tools.

3b2ca573cc6b3407b733e7746487dc73230074f9

issue.title: clarify "Setup a local testnet" (CSRF token not found)
issue.body:
The README.md says, at the end of the instructions for Setup a local testnet: "You should now be able to play with the DEX at http://localhost:1317" but connecting to that URL only gives the text "CSRF token not found".

Presumably the instructions in #1 is related to the missing information that ought to be added to the README.md (but #1 gives no details, and blindly following the instructions at "Join the live testnet" does not look promising).

3b2ca573cc6b3407b733e7746487dc73230074f9
